Create a bug hotel: Build a multi-level structure using recycled materials like bamboo, straws, and wood. This will provide a habitat for insects to live in, reducing their presence in your living space. Confidence score: 0.8

Use natural repellents: Plant herbs like basil, lavender, and mint in your garden, which are known to repel insects. You can also use essential oils like peppermint, lemongrass, and citronella to keep insects away. Confidence score: 0.9

Install a compost bin: Composting will help reduce food waste and create a natural fertilizer for your garden. This will also attract beneficial insects like ladybugs and lacewings, which will help control pest populations. Confidence score: 0.8

Create a beetle bank: Develop a habitat for beneficial beetles by planting flowers and herbs that attract them. Beetles will help control pest populations by feeding on insect eggs and larvae. Confidence score: 0.9

Use a sticky trap: Create a sticky trap using a plastic container, glue, and a funnel. Insects will get stuck in the glue, and you can dispose of them safely. This is a non-toxic and eco-friendly way to control pest populations. Confidence score: 0.8
